page.title: 04NETHERBURY POPULATION
page.content: The combined population of three parishes of Beaminster, Netherbury and Stoke Abbott in l89l was 3,868. In l98l this was 3,586. Beaminster's population has grown by about 1/4 whilst Netherbury's has declined by about 1/3 and Stoke Abbott's by 60%, no doubt due to the migration of rural workers and the loss of a once thriving local flax industry. Whilst the whole age range is represented here those aged over 60 outnumber the rest. This is an attractive retirement area and local property prices reflect this. (The former union workhouse is now regarded as a very good address!) Even so, neither Netherbury nor Stoke Abbott can boast a shop or post office and Netherbury recently lost its only pub.
